Item.text: SharePoint Framework

Item.SEODescription: The SharePoint Framework provides a modern developer experience for extending SharePoint.
Planned roadmap for the future SharePoint Framework versions.

Item.text: Tools and libraries
Item.SEODescription: Learn about the tools and libriaries you will need to use to build your SharePoint Framework solutions.

Item.text: Set up your Office 365 tenant
Item.SEODescription: Set up an Office 365 tenant so that you can test and debug your SharePoint client-side web parts

Item.text: Set up your development environment
Item.SEODescription: Set up and configure your development environment to build SharePoint client-side web parts

Item.text: Enterprise Guidance
Item.SEODescription: SharePoint Framework Enterprise architecture and development guidance.

Item.text: Team-based development
Item.SEODescription: Team-based development on SharePoint Framework.

Item.text: SharePoint Framework Toolchain
Item.SEODescription: The SharePoint Framework toolchain is the set of build tools, framework packages, and other items that manage building and deploying your client side projects.

Item.text: Yeoman Sharepoint generator
Item.SEODescription: Create new client-side solution projects using yeoman SharePoint generator.

Item.text: Update SharePoint Framework packages
Item.SEODescription: Process how to update SharePoint Framework packages to latest versions in your solutions.

Item.text: Optimize builds for production
Item.SEODescription: Optimizing SharePoint Framework builds for production deployment.

Item.text: Integrate gulp tasks in SharePoint Framework toolchain
Item.SEODescription: Integrate custom gulp tasks in the build pipeline used in SharePoint Framework solutions.

Item.text: Extending Webpack in SharePoint Framework toolchain
Item.SEODescription: Extend Webpack in the build pipeline used in SharePoint Framework solutions.

Item.text: Provision SharePoint assets
Item.SEODescription: SharePoint Framework toolchain allows you to package and deploy SharePoint fields, content types, list instances with your client-side solution package.

Item.text: Web parts

Item.SEODescription: Develop SharePoint client-side web parts to provide a better customized experience for SharePoint.

Item.text: Get started
Build your first web part
Item.SEODescription: Build a hello world SharePoint client-side web part.

Item.text: Connect to SharePoint
Item.SEODescription: Connect your SharePoint client-side web part to SharePoint by using page context.

Item.text: Deploy your web part to a SharePoint page
Item.SEODescription: Deploy your SharePoint client-side web part to a SharePoint page.

Item.text: Deploy to a CDN
Item.SEODescription: Deploy your SharePoint client-side web part assets to a CDN instead of using a local host.

Item.text: Add jQueryUI Accordion
Item.SEODescription: Add the jQueryUI Accordian to your SharePoint client-side web part project.

Item.text: Use Office UI Fabric React components
Item.SEODescription: Build a SharePoint client-side web part that uses the DocumentCard Office UI Fabric component.

Item.text: Provisioning assets from solution
Item.SEODescription: How to use SharePoint Framework to provision SharePoint assets to sites when solution is installed.

Item.text: Design considerations
Item.SEODescription: Design your SharePoint client-side web parts to use Office UI Fabric React components, be responsive, and handle publish and edit modes.

Item.text: Add properties to the property pane
Item.SEODescription: Set up properties for your SharePoint client-side web part and manage them through the property pane.

Item.text: Add an external library
Item.SEODescription: Add an external JavaScript library to your SharePoint client-side web part such as small libraries, non-AMD modules, and localized resources.

Item.text: Working with the original __RequestDigest
Item.SEODescription: Learn how to use the __REQUESTDIGEST form field in a web part in the SharePoint Framework

Item.text: Notes on solution packaging
Item.SEODescription: Understand definition details for files used for packaging web parts in solutions in the SharePoint Framework

Item.text: SharePoint Framework solutions governance considerations
Item.SEODescription: Governance considerations for organizations around SharePoint Framework.

Item.text: Use existing JavaScript libraries
Item.SEODescription: Best practices for using existing JavaScript libraries in your SharePoint client-side web parts.

Item.text: Reference third-party CSS styles
Item.SEODescription: Reference third party CSS styles in your SharePoint Framework client-side web parts.

Item.text: Using preconfigured entries
Item.SEODescription: Simplify adding web parts with preconfigured entries.

Item.text: Using JSOM in web part
Item.SEODescription: Connect to SharePoint using the JavaScript Object Model (JSOM).

Item.text: Validate property pane entries
Item.SEODescription: Validate property pane entries from end users.

Item.text: Use cascading dropdowns in property pane
Item.SEODescription: Using cascading dropdowns in property pane of your SharePoint Framework client-side web part.

Item.text: Build custom controls for the property pane
Item.SEODescription: Build custom controls for additional functionality for the property pane of your SharePoint Framework client-side web part.

Item.SEODescription: Options and practices on sharing data cross multiple web parts in single page.

Item.text: Sharing data between web parts (tutorial)
Item.SEODescription: Share data between web parts using a global variable (tutorial).

Item.text: Migrating Script Editor Web Part customizations
Item.SEODescription: Migrate existing Script Editor Web Part customizations to the SharePoint Framework.

Item.SEODescription: Using Office UI Fabric Core and Fabric React in SPFx client-side web parts.

Item.text: Build web parts with SP PnP JS
Item.SEODescription: Using SharePoint PnP JS library in your SharePoint Framework client-side web part implementation.

Item.SEODescription: Use Angular 1.x to build a simple SharePoint Framework client-side web part.

Item.SEODescription: Migrating existing Angular v1.x applications to SharePoint Framework client-side web parts.

Item.SEODescription: Complete basic operations using SharePoint REST endpoints.

Item.SEODescription: Navigate the SharePoint data structure represented in the REST service.

Item.SEODescription: Synchronize SharePoint items using the REST service.

Item.text: Upload a file
Item.SEODescription: Upload a file by using the REST API and jQuery.

Item.text: Manage permissions
Item.SEODescription: Set custom permissions son a list by using the REST interface.

Item.text: Batch requests
Item.SEODescription: Make batch requests with the SharePoint REST APIs.
SharePoint webhooks allow developers to build service integrations which subscribe to receive notifications on specific events that occur in SharePoint.

Item.text: Get started
Item.SEODescription: Get started building your own application that can add and handle SharePoint webhook requests.

Item.text: Reference implementation
Item.SEODescription: A SharePoint PnP sample reference implementation that shows how to use SharePoint webhooks using various Azure components such as Azure Web Jobs, Azure SQL Server and Azure Storage Queues.

Item.text: Azure Functions and SharePoint webhooks
Item.SEODescription: Explains how to use Azure Functions for hosting your SharePoint webhooks

Item.text: SharePoint lists

Item.SEODescription: SharePoint list webhooks notify your application about the events corresponding to list item changes for a given SharePoint list or a document library.

Item.text: Create a subscription
Item.SEODescription: Create a SharePoint webhook subscription using an HTTP POST request.

Item.text: Update a subscription
Item.SEODescription: Update a SharePoint webhook subscription using an HTTP PATCH request.

Item.text: Delete a subscription
Item.SEODescription: Delete a SharePoint webhook subscription using an HTTP DELETE request.

Item.text: Get subscriptions
Item.SEODescription: Get one or more SharePoint webhook subscriptions using an HTTP GET request.
